com.jswiff.io
Class OutputBitStream

java.lang.Object
  com.jswiff.io.OutputBitStream
public final class OutputBitStream
extends java.lang.Object

Implements a bit stream used for writing SWF files.

Constructor Summary
OutputBitStream()
          Creates a new memory OutputBitStream instance (with a ByteArrayOutputStream as internal stream, its data can be retrieved with the getData() method).
OutputBitStream(java.io.OutputStream stream)
          Creates a new OutputBitStream instance.
 
Method Summary
 void align()
          When this method is called, the content of the bit buffer is written and the current byte is filled up with zero bits.
 void close()
          Closes the internal stream.

          Enables stream compression (ZLIB, maximum compression level).
 void flush()
          Forces buffered data to be written out.

          Writes a float value as a 16 bit floating point number (half precision, or s10e5, i.e. 1 sign bit, 5 exponent bits and 10 mantissa bits).

Constructor Detail

OutputBitStream

public OutputBitStream()
Creates a new memory OutputBitStream instance (with a ByteArrayOutputStream as internal stream, its data can be retrieved with the getData() method).

OutputBitStream

public OutputBitStream(java.io.OutputStream stream)
Creates a new OutputBitStream instance.

Parameters:
stream - the internal stream used for output data.
Method Detail

align

public void align()
           throws java.io.IOException
When this method is called, the content of the bit buffer is written and the current byte is filled up with zero bits.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
Closes the internal stream. After this, data cannot be written anymore.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred

enableCompression

public void enableCompression()
Enables stream compression (ZLIB, maximum compression level).

flush

public void flush()
           throws java.io.IOException
Forces buffered data to be written out.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred

getData

public byte[] getData()
Returns the stream data.

Returns:
byte array containing the output data
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if called on a non-memory stream

getFPBitsLength

public static int getFPBitsLength(double value)
Returns the number of bits needed for the representation of a given fixed point value. Returns values between 2 and 64 because fixed point values are represented as long numbers.

Parameters:
value - a double value (representing a fixed point number)
Returns:
number of bits needed for the representation of the value

getOffset

public long getOffset()
Returns the stream offset, i.e. the number of bytes (fully) written.

Returns:
the stream offset

getSignedBitsLength

public static int getSignedBitsLength(long value)
Returns the number of bits needed for the representation of a given signed value. Signed values are represented using at least 2 bits, so the method returns at least a value of 2. The maximum returned value is 64.

Parameters:
value - a long value (representing a signed integer)
Returns:
number of bits needed for the representation of the value

getUnsignedBitsLength

public static int getUnsignedBitsLength(long value)
Returns the number of bits needed for the representation of a given unsigned value. For negative values, the method returns 0. For 0 or 1 as value, a length of 1 bit is returned. The maximum returned value is 64.

Parameters:
value - a long value (representing an unsigned integer)
Returns:
number of bits needed for the representation of the value

isANSI

public boolean isANSI()
Checks whether ANSI encoding is to be used when encoding strings.

Returns:
true for ANSI encoding

isShiftJIS

public boolean isShiftJIS()
Checks whether Shift-JIS encoding is to be used when encoding strings.

Returns:
true for Shift-JIS encoding

setANSI

public void setANSI(boolean ansi)
Specifies whether ANSI encoding is to be used when encoding strings.

Parameters:
ansi - true for ANSI encoding

setShiftJIS

public void setShiftJIS(boolean shiftJIS)
Specifies whether Shift-JIS encoding is to be used when encoding strings.

Parameters:
shiftJIS - true for Shift-JIS encoding

writeBooleanBit

public void writeBooleanBit(boolean value)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Writes a boolean byte as one bit. For true, a 1 is written, for false, a 0.

Parameters:
value - a boolean value
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error has occurred

writeFloat16

public void writeFloat16(float value)
                  throws java.io.IOException
Writes a float value as a 16 bit floating point number (half precision, or s10e5, i.e. 1 sign bit, 5 exponent bits and 10 mantissa bits).

Parameters:
value - float value
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occured

                        int nBits)
                 throws java.io.IOException

Parameters:
value - a fixed point number as double value
